titleproper.value: Guide to the Time Inc. Staff Organizations<lb/>1940-2015<lb/> <num>MS 3009-RG 18</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Holly Deakyne and Melanie Rinehart

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-11-27T14:38:59</date>

abstract.value: Time Inc. Staff Organizations contains records from clubs, sports, and other membership organizations involving only Time Inc. staff. The organizations include the Time Inc. Bowling League, Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW), and the Time-Life Alumni Society.

p.value: Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials include membership information in Series II. Restricted materials are located in boxes R14. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis. Unreformatted digital material in the collection is not accessible. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Staff Organizations, MS 3009-RG 18, New-York Historical Society.

Time Inc. Staff Organizations contains records from clubs, sports, and other membership organizations involving only Time Inc. staff. These organizations were not necessarily sanctioned or overseen by Time Inc., but rather staff-driven. The organizations include the Time Inc. Bowling League, Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW), and the Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS).

dsc.value:
Series I. Bowling League Records1943044.5 Linear feetin 3 record cartons, 2 flat boxes1961-1971, undatedScope and Contents Note

The Bowling League Records document Time Inc.'s staff bowling league from 1961 to 1971. Based on the records, members in charge at various times were Bud Bliven, Carol-Ann Carpentieri, Joyce Christiansen, Loretta Geissler, Rod McDonald, Mary Piper, Val Pour, and Marian Powers. While teams list both men and women members, there are some records for the Woman's Bowling League from the same time period. Records include lists of participants; certifications and sanctions from the national bowling organizations; invitations and planning materials for league luncheons, awards banquets, and the 25th anniversary; newsletters and flyers; record books containing scores, statistics, and schedules; scorecards; registration sheets; photographic material; a scrapbook; a photograph album; and buttons. The "General" files may contain any of these materials. The newsletter was at one point called b.i.f., which was the motto "Bowling is Fun," and looks styled after the Time Inc. newsletter F.Y.I. The folder "Old Time Inc. Bowlers" includes lists of participants going back to the 1950s.

Arrangement Note

Organized chronologically by bowling season, then alphabetically by topic or record type. Undated materials are at the end.

Photographs and Negatives194341undated78911Sketches194342undated78912Series II. Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW) Records1949031 Linear feetin 2 record cartons1988-1997Biographical/Historical Note

Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW) was a staff grassroots organization at Time Warner from 1990 to 1995. Its goal was to be an "education and support group that addresses workplace issues affecting employees who are lesbian, gay, or bisexual". Later iterations of the group include Out@TimeWarner and Out@TimeInc.

Scope and Contents Note

Records include advocacy correspondence, meeting agenda, membership cards and contact lists, event planning materials, newsletters, memoranda, news clippings, and reference material. Membership lists and other materials naming members other than the Coordinating Committee are restricted since member confidentiality was assured by the group.

Arrangement Note

Organized chronologically by year, then alphabetically by topic or record type. Undated materials are at the beginning.

Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS) Collection6 Linear feetin 6 record cartons1940-2015Biographical / Historical

The Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS) was founded in October 1977 by several retiring editors as a way to keep former Time Inc. employees connected to Time Inc. and each other after leaving the company. Receiving a small stipend by Time Inc. to print invitations and a newsletter, as well as office space, TLAS used member dues to fund several luncheons with guest speakers per year prior to 2018. Notable members include Dick Stolley, Norm Pearlstine, John Huey, Ralph Graves, and Maureen Dowd.

Scope and Contents

Materials include videocassettes, audiocassettes, photographs, member directories, memos, meeting minutes, newsletters, news clippings, and correspondence. These are records gathered by the Time Inc. Archives from TLAS and do not reflect TLAS's original organizational records.

Arrangement

Organized into five subseries: Subseries III.A. President's FilesSubseries III.B. Newsletters and Membership Directories Subseries III.C. PhotographsSubseries III.D. Audiovisual materials Subseries III.E. General

Subseries III.A. President's Files1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1980-2005Scope and Contents

Dick Stolley, whose materials from time as TLAS president are included, was an editor at various Time Inc. publications for over 40 years. His most notable moment was when he, as Life magazine editor, negotiated to purchase rights to the Zapruder film of the Kennedy assassination. Materials are dated from 2000 to 2005 and contain materials such as news clippings or personal letters from TLAS members, obituaries regarding past TLAS members, and internal correspondence or memos regarding TLAS activities.

Arrangement

Arranged in reverse chronological order.

Directory of Members200527861Time-Life Alumni Society Miscellaneous2001-200427862-9Time-Life Alumni Society AOL Deal2001278610-11Time-Life Alumni Society Miscellaneous2000278612-14Luncheon Guests1980-200727871Carky Rubens Posterundated27872Subseries III.B. Newsletters And Membership Directories1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1979-2015Scope and Contents

The member directories and newsletters range from 1979 to 2015. Newsletters also contain extra souvenir pamphlets from TLAS-sponsored parties or "Travels with TLAS".

Arrangement

Arranged alphabetically, then in reverse chronological order within each group.

Membership Directories1978-201127873-7Newsletters1977-201527878-10Subseries III.C. Photographs1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1940-1988Scope and Contents

Most of the photographs are of TLAS parties or "Travels with TLAS", which consisted of tours in locations such as Storm King, Paris, and Washington, D.C. One set of photographs, from the now-defunct 1940s employee group Time Out, is from Daniel and Mary Fraser Longwell's personal collection, sent to Marian McDermott in 1978; Daniel helped found Life magazine and was an editor for ten years, and Mary was a chief of research at Time (Prendergast and Colvin 449). Please note this Time Out group is not associated with the later LGBT staff organization.

Arrangement

Arranged in reverse chronological, with undated materials at the end.

Audiovisual materials [RESTRICTED]2 Linear feetin 2 record cartons1985-2001Scope and Contents

Videocassettes are recordings of TLAS luncheon presentations and panels. Notable speakers include Hugh Sidey, Dick Stolley, Norm Pearlstine, and Martha Stewart.

The audiocassettes are recordings of TLAS luncheon presentations.

Arrangement

Arranged by subject of event, then by speakers.
